Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Skipton is a busy Market Town and is the tourism centre in North Yorkshire known as the Gateway to the Dales. The town lies approximately 26 miles north west of Leeds, 45 miles north east of Manchester and 2 miles west of Harrogate. Skipton train station provides connections to Leeds, Bradford, Carlisle and the wider national networks. The property occupies a position on Swadford Street. The area comprises a mix of local and national occupiers including CardFactory, Specsavers and Subway.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy ground and first floor. The ground floor comprises a main sales area and customer toilets while the first floor provides staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 16/04/2028. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £20,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £15,000.00 and the rates payable are £7,365.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Harrogate is an affluent spa town in North Yorkshire located approximately 17 miles north of Leeds and 22 miles west of York. The town is a popular tourist destination and is renowned for its Victorian Baths, tea shops and the Harrogate International Conference Centre. 

The subject premises occupy a position on the Leeds Road, one of the arterial routes into Harrogate, approximately 1 mile south of the town centre. Thus, benefitting from a high flow of vehicular traffic. The retail parade comprises a mix of local and national retailers including Dominos, Subway and Co-op.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy ground floor comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 24/12/2021.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £21,200, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £11,000.00 and the rates payable are £5,489.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Malton is a busy affluent market town situated approximately 19 miles north east of York and 23 miles west of Scarborough.  The town has transport links to the A64 providing access to J44 of the A1(M). Malton is known for its excellent food offering and is home to the renowned Food Lovers Festival and Monthly Food Lovers Market.  

The property occupies a position on Yorkersgate which forms part of the main retail provision in the town. Surrounding occupiers comprise a mixture of good quality local retail and leisure operators.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit occupies the ground and basement floors of a three-storey character building comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space. The basement provides additional storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 05/04/2030, with the option to break on 05/04/2025.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £12,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £14,000 and the rates payable are £6,874 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Scarborough is a popular seaside town located on the North Yorkshire Coast.  The town lies approximately 41 miles north east of York and 45 miles north of Hull.  The A64 provides direct access to the south west to York and Leeds, with Middlesbrough accessed via the A171 to the north west. Scarborough has connections to York, Leeds, and London via the rail network.

The subject unit occupies a position on Huntriss Row National retailers in the immediate vicinity include Mainline Menswear, McDonald’s, KFC and Yorkshire Bank.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit occupies the ground floor of a four storey property and comprises a large main sales area, staff accommodation, customer toilets and storage space. The property benefits from having two entrance points, one via Huntriss Row, and the other via Bar Street.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 24/03/2021.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £27,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £19,000.00 and the rates payable are £9,329.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Whitby is a very popular seaside town located in Yorkshire. It is situated just 35 miles East of Stockton-on-Tees and 19 miles North of Scarborough.

The subject property is located on Flowergate which this is one of the busiest shopping streets in the town centre. Some of the national retailers in the immediate vicinity include Poundland, Mountain Warehouse, Halifax and Boots.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
This property is arranged over ground and first floors. The ground floor comprises a traditional TSB bank layout with a main banking hall, staff accommodation and offices. Whereas the first floor provides further storage and staff toilets.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 19/02/2030 with a break option on 19/02/2025. 

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £23,000 per annum, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the property is £20,500. The UBR for 2021/2022 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.
